net.canarymod.plugin

Class Plugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.plugin.Plugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandOwner, MOTDOwner, TaskOwner

    public abstract class Plugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommandOwner, TaskOwner, MOTDOwner
    A Canary Mod Plugin.
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter), Jason (darkdiplomat)

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public abstract boolean enable()
        CanaryMod will call this upon enabling this plugin
        Returns:
        true to signal successful enable; false if known to be unable to run

      • disable

        public abstract void disable()
        CanaryMod will call this upon disabling this plugin

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Return the Plugin's name.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface CommandOwner
        Specified by:
        getName in interface MOTDOwner
        Returns:
        the Plugin's name

      • setName

        public final void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the Plugin's name. Used internally since plugins are stored by name. Calling this outside of PluginLifecycle.load() may end disastrously

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Gets the Plugin's priority.
        Returns:
        The Plugin's priority.

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int priority)
        Set this Plugin's priority level. This will affect the order of hook execution.
        Parameters:
        priority - the Priority level

      • getVersion

        public final java.lang.String getVersion()
        Get the version string of the Plugin The Version should be set in the Canary.inf as "version=[version]"
        Returns:
        the version if found; "UNKNOWN" if not found

      • getAuthor

        public final java.lang.String getAuthor()
        Get this Plugin Author's name The Author's name should be set in the Canary.inf as "author=[author]"
        Returns:
        Author's name if found; "UNKNOWN" if not found

        public java.lang.String getJarName()
        Deprecated. Plugins may or may not be in a jar file. This method will return null if there is no jar.

      • getCanaryInf

        public final PropertiesFile getCanaryInf()
        Gets the Plugin's Canary.inf file

        NOTE: DO NOT CALL PropertiesFile#save()
        Saving is unsupported

        If the Plugin is reloaded, any changes will be lost

        Returns:
        the Plugin's Canary.inf

        Gets the server-wide configuration of the Plugin
        Returns:
        configuration of the Plugin
        See Also:
        Configuration.getPluginConfig(Plugin)

      • getModuleConfig

        public final PropertiesFile getModuleConfig(java.lang.String module)
        Gets the server-wide configuration of the Plugin
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        configuration of the Plugin
        See Also:
        Configuration.getPluginConfig(Plugin, String)

      • getWorldConfig

        public final PropertiesFile getWorldConfig(World world)
        Gets the world-specific configuration of the Plugin. If there is no world-specific configuration, it will take the server-wide configuration.
        Parameters:
        world - the World to get configuration for
        Returns:
        configuration of the Plugin for the specified World
        See Also:
        Configuration.getPluginConfig(Plugin, World)

      • getWorldModuleConfig

        public final PropertiesFile getWorldModuleConfig(java.lang.String module,
                                                 World world)
        Gets the world-specific configuration of the Plugin. If there is no world-specific configuration, it will take the server-wide configuration.
        Parameters:
        module - Used to create multiple configurations for the Plugin.
        world - the World to get configuration for
        Returns:
        configuration of the Plugin for the specified World
        See Also:
        Configuration.getPluginConfig(Plugin, String, World)

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Check if this plugin needs a new instance instead of just re-enabling it
        Returns:
        true if closed; false otherwise

      • markClosed

      • isDisabled

        public final boolean isDisabled()
        Gets whether this Plugin is disabled
        Returns:
        true if disabled; false if enabled

      • registerCommands

        public final void registerCommands(CommandListener listener,
                                   boolean force)
                            throws CommandDependencyException
        Register your CommandListener. This will make all annotated commands available to CanaryMod and the help system. Sub Command relations can only be sorted out after availability. That means if you try to register a command that is a sub-command of something that is not registered yet, it will fail. So make sure you add commands in the correct order.
        Parameters:
        listener - the CommandListener
        force - true to override existing commands; false for not
        Throws:
        CommandDependencyException

      • registerCommands

        public final void registerCommands(CommandListener listener,
                                   LocaleHelper translator,
                                   boolean force)
                            throws CommandDependencyException
        Register your CommandListener. This will make all annotated commands available to CanaryMod and the help system. Sub Command relations can only be sorted out after availability. That means if you try to register a command that is a sub-command of something that is not registered yet, it will fail. So make sure you add commands in the correct order.
        Parameters:
        listener - the CommandListener
        translator - the LocaleHelper instance used in Translations
        force - true to override existing commands; false for not
        Throws:
        CommandDependencyException

        public final void registerListener(PluginListener listener)
        Register a PluginListener for a system hook
